source.title: Default network activity, coupled with the frontoparietal control network, supports goal-directed cognition

confidence_rationale: Strong mixed evidence that goal-directed behavior can involve DMN-control cooperation, limiting strict action-mode suppression claims.

mapping.source_claim_statement: Goal-directed cognition can involve cooperative coupling between default-network and frontoparietal control systems.
mapping.ree_translation: Mixed for MECH-025: action mode should allow conditional reflective-lane coupling under some goal structures, not absolute DMN exclusion.
mapping.mapping_caveat: Task class and cognitive demand strongly modulate coupling patterns; not all enaction contexts behave this way.
mapping.source_context: Meta-analytic and connectivity evidence on goal-directed cognition network coupling.

confidence_components.notes: Key boundary source preventing over-rigid action-mode assumptions.
